content.html:
First Post using GraphCMS and Gatsby. Web servers are incredibly good at serving HTML, CSS & Javascript. The ability to build a static website off of dynamic data is an incredibly fun paradigm. Once deployed there's no SSR, no database calls, no server side computation - just HTML, CSS, JS, and assets served over the wire. The result is a blazing fast site right out of the box.

I understand that this site is fairly simple, however, my lighthouse scores are incredibly strong right out of the gate. Performance is only dinged because I have a client side request for the programming quotes which causes a slight content shift on load. With a small amount of work I can get performance and accessibility up to 100% without breaking a sweat.

I'll have to remember to do a more detailed writeup of my overall experience but my initial thoughts are very positive.
